sentences.sentence: The Two Enemies
Two men, deadly enemies to each other, were sailing( 航行 ) in the same ship.
Determined to keep as far apart as possible, the one seated himself in the back, and the other in the front of the ship.
There was a huge storm, and with the ship in great danger of sinking( 沉没 ), the one in the back asked the captain( 船长 ) which end of the ship would go down first.
The captain( 船长 ) said that he thought it would probably be the front.
The man in the back said, “Then I will die in peace, if only I can see my enemy die before me.”
MORAL: Let go of your hatred, at least before you die.
The Two Frogs( 青蛙 )
A frog( 青蛙 ) lived in a very small muddy( 泥泞的 ) area by the side of a road.
His frog( 青蛙 ) friend, who lived in a large, deep lake with no humans nearby, said to him,
“Why don’t you come and live with me? There is more space and more food, and where I live is also much safer.”
But the first frog( 青蛙 ) said, “You may be right, but I am too old to change—and besides, nothing bad has happened to me yet.”
But a few days later, a cart( 马车 ) went off the road and he was crushed( 被压扁 ) under its wheels.
MORAL: Don’t be too lazy to change when change is needed.
The Two Roosters( 公鸡 ) and the Eagle( 鹰 )
There were two roosters( 公鸡 ) in the same farmyard( 农场 ), and they fought to decide who should be master( 主人 ).
When the fight was over, the beaten one went and hid himself in a dark corner,
while the winner flew up on to the roof( 屋顶 ) and loudly let everyone know that he had won.
But an eagle( 鹰 ) saw and heard him from high up in the sky, and flew down and carried him off.
Then the other rooster( 公鸡 ) came out of his corner and ruled the farmyard( 农场 ) without a rival( 竞争者 ).
MORAL: Sometimes it’s best to keep quiet about your successes.
The Wild Boar( 野猪 ) and the Fox( 狐狸 )
A wild boar( 野猪 ) was sharpening( 磨尖 ) his horns( 角 ) on a tree, when a fox( 狐狸 ) coming by asked why he did so.
“I see no reason why you do that. There is neither hunter( 猎人 ) nor hound( 猎犬 ) in sight, nor any other danger that I can see.”
“True,” replied the boar( 野猪 );
“but when that danger comes, I will have something else to do than to sharpen( 磨尖 ) my weapons( 武器 ).”
MORAL: Make your preparations early.
The Wind and the Sun
The wind and the sun once argued about who was the stronger of the two.
They agreed that whoever made a traveler take off his coat first, would be the most powerful.
The wind began, and blew as hard as he could.
However, the stronger he blew, the closer the traveler wrapped( 裹 ) his coat around him.
Then came the sun.
As the sun shone brightly, the man felt warmer, so he took off his coat and all his other clothes, and went for a swim in the river.
So, the sun was the winner.
MORAL: Persuasion( 劝说 ) works better than force.
The Wolf( 狼 ) and the Crane( 鹤 )
A wolf( 狼 ) who had a bone( 骨头 ) stuck in his throat( 喉咙 ) offered to pay a crane( 鹤 ) to put her head into his mouth and take out the bone( 骨头 ).
When the crane( 鹤 ) had taken the bone( 骨头 ) and asked for the money, the wolf( 狼 ), smiling, said,
“You are lucky enough, for you were allowed to pull your head out safely from the mouth of a wolf( 狼 ).”
MORAL: When helping evil( 邪恶的 ) people, expect no reward( 报酬 ), and be thankful if you don’t get hurt.

question.cn: 在故事The Two Enemies中，船长认为船的哪一端会先沉没？
question.en: In the story The Two Enemies, which end of the ship would go down first in the captain's opinion?

analysis: 文中提到：“The captain said that he thought it would probably be the front.”可知，先沉的应该是船头，因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事The Two Frogs的结尾，居住在小泥坑中的青蛙怎么了？
question.en: In the end of the story The Two Frogs, what happened to the frog who lived in a small muddy area?

options.en: He was crushed by a cart.
He died from a lack of food.

options.cn: 他被一个小男孩抓走了。
options.en: He was caught by a boy.

analysis: 文中提到：“But a few days later, a cart went off the road and he was crushed under its wheels.”可知，最后青蛙被车轧死了，因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事The Two Roosters and the Eagle中，胜者发生了什么？
question.en: In the story The Two Roosters and the Eagle, what happened to the winner?

options.en: He was caught by an eagle.

options.cn: 他把自己藏在一个黑暗的角落里。
options.en: He hid himself in a dark corner.

analysis: 文中提到：“Let everyone know that he had won. But an eagle saw and heard him from high up in the sky, and flew down and carried him off.”可知，胜者最后被老鹰抓走了，因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事The Wind and the Sun中，谁是胜者？
question.en: In the story The Wind and the Sun, who was the winner?

analysis: 文中提到：“He took off his coat and all his other clothes, and went for a swim in the river. So, the sun was the winner. ”因此选A。

question.cn: 在故事The Wolf and the Crane中，狼有没有给鹤报酬？
question.en: In the story The Wolf and the Crane, did the wolf give the crane reward?

analysis: 文中提到，当鹤向狼索要报酬的时候，狼说：“When helping evil people, expect no reward, and be thankful if you don’t get hurt.”可见狼没有给鹤任何报酬，因此选B。
